title: Hasshub
html: HASSHUB(Hasʹshub) [One Who Is Accounting (Considering)].1. Son of Pahath-moab; one of those who did repair work when the wall of Jerusalem was being rebuilt under Nehemiah’s direction.—Ne 3:11.2. One who repaired a section of the wall of Jerusalem, evidently a section in front of his house.—Ne 3:23.3. One of the heads of the people whose descendant, if not he himself, attested by seal the “trustworthy arrangement” contracted during Nehemiah’s governorship.—Ne 9:38; 10:1, 14, 23.4. A Merarite Levite; son of Azrikam and father of Shemaiah.—1Ch 9:14; Ne 11:15.
